data.event: The World Health Organization (WHO) said on Thursday that over 31,250 cases of cholera have been reported so far this year in nine West African countries.
"If we look at this year's trends, the figures are still going up in many countries," said John Mulangu, a senior regional advisor for the WHO.
The WHO issued a statement on Thursday that more countries were at risk.
"Outbreaks are likely to spread to Central Africa - Nigeria, Cameroon and Chad - in the next weeks," it said.
